chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
i: nat
n: nat

Goal:
exp i vec_zero = 1

Premises:
vec_zero = fun n : nat => vec_set_pos (fun _ : pos n => 0) : forall n : nat, vec nat n Arguments vec_zero {n}%nat_scope
exp = fix exp (n i : nat) (v : vec nat n) {struct v} : nat := match v with | vec_nil => 1 | Vector.cons _ x n0 v0 => qs i ^ x * exp n0 (S i) v0 end : forall n : nat, nat -> vec nat n -> nat Arguments exp {n}%nat_scope _%nat_scope
exp_cons : forall (n i x : nat) (v : vec nat n), exp i (x ## v) = qs i ^ x * exp (S i) v
exp_nil : forall i : nat, exp i vec_nil = 1
vec_plus_is_zero : forall (n : nat) (u v : vec nat n), vec_zero = vec_plus u v -> u = vec_zero /\ v = vec_zero
vec_zero_S : forall n : nat, vec_zero = 0 ## vec_zero
vec_sum_is_zero : forall (n : nat) (v : vec nat n), vec_sum v = 0 -> v = vec_zero
pos_S_inv : forall p : pos (S ?n), (p = pos0) + {q : pos ?n | p = pos_nxt q} where ?n : [n : nat i : nat |- nat]
vec_zero_plus : forall (n : nat) (v : vec nat n), vec_plus vec_zero v = v
vec_sum_zero : forall n : nat, vec_sum vec_zero = 0
vec_one_fst : forall n : nat, vec_one pos0 = 1 ## vec_zero
vec_map_list_zero : forall (X : Type) (n : nat) (f : pos n -> X), vec_map_list vec_zero f = nil
pos_O_inv = let pos_inv_t := fun n : nat => match n as x return (pos x -> Set) with | 0 => fun _ : pos 0 => False | S n0 => fun i : pos (S n0) => ((i = pos0) + {p : pos n0 | i = pos_nxt p})%type end in let pos_inv := fun (_tmp : nat) (p0 : pos _tmp) => match p0 as t in (pos n) return (pos_inv_t n t) with | @Fin.F1 n => inl eq_refl | @Fin.FS n p => inr (exist (fun p1 : pos n => pos_nxt p = pos_nxt p1) p eq_refl) end in pos_inv 0 : pos 0 -> False
vec_nat_induction : forall (n : nat) (P : vec nat n -> Type), P vec_zero -> (forall p : pos n, P (vec_one p)) -> (forall v w : vec nat n, P v -> P w -> P (vec_plus v w)) -> forall v : vec nat n, P v
divides = fun n k : nat => exists p : nat, k = p * n : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments divides (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.divide = fun x y : nat => exists z : nat, y = z * x : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments Nat.divide (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.Bezout = fun n m p : nat => exists a b : nat, a * n = p + b * m : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments Nat.Bezout (_ _ _)%nat_scope
div = fun q p : nat => projT1 (div_full q p) : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments div (_ _)%nat_scope
rem = fun q p : nat => proj1_sig (projT2 (div_full q p)) : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments rem (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.log2 = fun n : nat => Init.Nat.log2_iter (Init.Nat.pred n) 0 1 0 : nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.log2 _%nat_scope
Nat.lcm = fun a b : nat => a * (b / Nat.gcd a b) : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Nat.lcm (_ _)%nat_scope
prime = fun p : nat => p <> 1 /\ (forall q : nat, divides q p -> q = 1 \/ q = p) : nat -> Prop Arguments prime _%nat_scope
lt = fun n m : nat => S n <= m : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments lt (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.pred = fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => n | S u => u end : nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.pred _%nat_scope
Init.Nat.div = fun x y : nat => match y with | 0 => y | S y' => fst (Init.Nat.divmod x y' 0 y') end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.div (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.divide_wd = fun (x x' : nat) (Hx : x = x') (y y' : nat) (Hy : y = y') => Morphisms.trans_co_eq_inv_impl_morphism RelationClasses.iff_Transitive (exists p : nat, y = p * x) (exists p : nat, y = p * x') (Morphisms_Prop.ex_iff_morphism (fun p : nat => y = p * x) (fun p : nat => y = p * x') (fun p : nat => Morphisms.per_partial_app_morphism (RelationClasses.Equivalence_PER Nat.eq_equiv) (p * x) (p * x') (Morphisms.Reflexive_partial_app_morphism Nat.mul_wd (Morphisms.reflexive_proper_proxy RelationClasses.Equivalence_Reflexive p) x x' Hx))) (exists p : nat, y' = p * x') (exists p : nat, y' = p * x') (Morphisms.eq_proper_proxy (exists p : nat, y' = p * x')) (Morphisms.trans_co_eq_inv_impl_morphism RelationClasses...
Nat.log2_up = fun a : nat => match 1 ?= a with | Lt => S (Nat.log2 (Nat.pred a)) | _ => 0 end : nat -> nat Arguments Nat.log2_up _%nat_scope
Init.Nat.modulo = fun x y : nat => match y with | 0 => y | S y' => y' - snd (Init.Nat.divmod x y' 0 y') end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.modulo (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.add = fix add (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => m | S p => S (add p m) end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.add (_ _)%nat_scope
pow2 = fix pow2 (p : nat) : nat := match p with | 0 => 1 | S p0 => 2 * pow2 p0 end : nat -> nat Arguments pow2 _%nat_scope
Init.Nat.mul = fix mul (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => 0 | S p => m + mul p m end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.mul (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.pow = fix pow (n m : nat) {struct m} : nat := match m with | 0 => 1 | S m0 => n * pow n m0 end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.pow (_ _)%nat_scope
pow2_2n1_dec : forall n : nat, {p : nat & {b : nat | S n = pow2 p * (2 * b + 1)}}
vec_plus = fun (n : nat) (v w : vec nat n) => vec_set_pos (fun p : pos n => (v#>p) + (w#>p)) : forall n : nat, vec nat n -> vec nat n -> vec nat n Arguments vec_plus {n}%nat_scope
Init.Nat.gcd = fix gcd (a b : nat) {struct a} : nat := match a with | 0 => b | S a' => gcd (b mod S a') (S a') end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.gcd (_ _)%nat_scope
is_gcd = fun p q r : nat => divides r p /\ divides r q /\ (forall k : nat, divides k p -> divides k q -> divides k r) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments is_gcd (_ _ _)%nat_scope
BinIntDef.Z.of_nat = fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => BinNums.Z0 | S n0 => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.of_succ_nat n0) end : nat -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.of_nat _%nat_scope
str = fun p : primestream => let (str, _, _) := p in str : primestream -> nat -> nat Arguments str _ _%nat_scope str is a coercion
euclid : forall n d : nat, d <> 0 -> {q : nat & {r : nat | n = q * d + r /\ r < d}}
Init.Nat.sub = fix sub (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => n | S k => match m with | 0 => n | S l => sub k l end end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.sub (_ _)%nat_scope
vec_sum_is_nzero : forall (n : nat) (v : vec nat n), 0 < vec_sum v -> {p : pos n & {w : vec nat n | v = vec_plus (vec_one p) w}}
Nat.b2n = fun b : bool => if b then 1 else 0 : bool -> nat Arguments Nat.b2n _%bool_scope
